title: IPTC ninjs - News in JSON - version 3.0
description: A news item as JSON object -- copyright 2024 IPTC - International Press Telecommunications Council - www.iptc.org - This document is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 license, see  http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

datesObjectType.description: All dates pertaining to an event, a planning or a coverage, in particular the start and end date and any recurrence information

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: The date and time at which the event starts.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: The date and time at which the event ends.

expectedStartDate.description: The approximate date (and optionally time) at which the event or coverage is expected to start.

expectedEndDate.description: The approximate date (and optionally time) at which the event or coverage is expected to end.

expectedDuration.description: The time period that the event or coverage is expected to last. Must use the iCalendar duration format (RFC 5545). (Actual duration can be calculated from startDate and endDate)

recurrence.description: Specifies recurrence information about the event.

recurrenceDates.description: Date(s) (and optionally times) on which the event occurs.

recurrenceRules.description: Date(s) (and optionally times) on which the event occurs.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: The FREQ rule part identifies the type of recurrence rule.

interval.description: The INTERVAL rule part contains a positive integer representing how often the recurrence rule repeats.

until.description: The UNTIL rule part defines a date-time value which bounds the recurrence rule in an inclusive manner.

count.description: The COUNT rule part defines the number of occurrences at which to range-bound the recurrence.

type.description: Type would be method of communication like phone, mobile, address etc.

role.description: Role refers to type and could be private, office etc

lang.description: Language of this contactInfo instance. The value should follow IETF BCP47.

name.description: Human-readable name of the contact method, such as a name for a web page, name of persons twitter account etc

value.description: Actual phone number, email address, web url etc.

address.description: The address of a person, place or organisation.

lines.description: An array of lines to construct an address. The order is important to construct a correct address.

items.description: One line in the address lines array.

locality.description: A city/town/village etc. part of the address.

area.description: A subdivision of a country part of the address.

postalCode.description: A postal code part of the address.

country.description: A country part of the address.

by.title: By
by.description: The person or party that commissioned the content.

on.title: On
on.description: The date at which the content was commissioned.

references.title: References
references.description: Identifiers that help with the commissioning process such as purchase orders and work order numbers.

truncatedDateTimeType.description: Allows any of year (xs:gYear, YYYY), year/month (xs:gYearMonth, YYYY-MM), year/month/day (xs:date YYYY-MM-DD), and full datetime (xs:dateTime, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM), all with an optional timezone suffix. Note that this does NOT include ISO8601 month of year (xs:gMonth, --MM) or yearly day (xs:gMonthDay, --MM-DD)

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the organisation.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the organisation as a complete uri.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the organisation as a free-text string.

symbols.title: Symbols
symbols.description: Symbols used for a financial instrument linked to the organisation at a specific market place

exchange.title: Exchange
exchange.description: Identifier for the marketplace which uses the ticker symbols of the symbol property

symbolType.title: Symbol type uri
symbolType.description: Type of financial symbol used. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/financialinstrumentsymboltype/

renditionType.description: A specific rendition of the content of the news object.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of this object in the array of renditions, for example 'thumbnail'. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/rendition/

href.title: href
href.description: The URL for accessing the rendition as a resource.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The IANA Media Type which applies to this rendition.

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for the link to the rendition resource

width.title: Width
width.description: For still and moving images: the width of the display area measured in pixels.

height.title: Height
height.description: For still and moving images: the height of the display area measured in pixels.

sizeInBytes.title: Size in bytes
sizeInBytes.description: The size of the rendition resource in bytes.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The total time duration of the content in seconds (fractional seconds are allowed).

format.title: Format
format.description: A refinement of a generic content type (i.e. IANA media type) by a literal string value. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/format/

aspectRatio.title: Aspect ratio
aspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio of an image or video file, which is the ratio of the pixel width to its height, such as 16:9 and 4:3.

videoCodec.title: Video codec
videoCodec.description: The video encoding system used to create the content. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/videocodec/

frameRate.title: Frame rate
frameRate.description: The number of video frames per second, which is the rate at which the material should be shown in order to achieve the intended visual effect.

poi.title: Point of Interest
poi.description: The main point of interest of the rendition, expressed in pixels from the top left.

x.title: X
x.description: The x-coordinate of the point of interest of the rendition.

y.title: Y
y.description: The y-coordinate of the point of interest of the rendition.

transportProtocol.title: Transport protocol
transportProtocol.description: The transport/flow type of the flow (B2B stream).

scanType.title: Scan type (video profile)
scanType.description: The scan type of the video i.e. progressive or interlaced.

bitrate.title: Bitrate
bitrate.description: The bitrate of the video. Should always include units, e.g. 400 kbps.

newsObjectType.title: Type
newsObjectType.description: The generic news type of this news object. Based on http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/ninature/

ninjsType.description: The root schema of ninjs as a type to make it possible to combine schema parts.

uri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier
uri.description: The global unique identifier for this news object. This is the only required property and should be used to identify the ninjs object, not for links to external resources etc.

representationType.title: Representation type
representationType.description: Indicates how complete this representation of a news item is.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: An identifier for the structure of the news object. This can be any string but we suggest something identifying the structure of the content such as 'text-only' or 'text-photo'. Profiles are typically provider-specific.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the news object which is identified by the uri property.

firstCreated.title: First created
firstCreated.description: Indicates when the first version of this ninjs object was created.

versionCreated.title: Version created
versionCreated.description: The date and time when this version of this ninjs object was created.

contentCreated.title: Content created
contentCreated.description: The date and time when the content of this ninjs object was originally created. For example an old photo that is now handled as a ninjs object.

embargoedUntil.title: Embargoed until
embargoedUntil.description: The date and time before which all versions of the news object are embargoed. If absent, this object is not embargoed.

pubStatus.title: Publication status
pubStatus.description: The publishing status of the news object. Default value is 'usable'.

urgency.title: Urgency
urgency.description: The editorial urgency of the content. Values from 1 to 9. 1 represents the highest urgency, 9 the lowest.

copyrightHolder.title: Copyright holder
copyrightHolder.description: The person or organisation claiming the intellectual property for the content.

copyrightNotice.title: Copyright notice
copyrightNotice.description: Any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for the content.

usageTerms.title: Usage terms
usageTerms.description: A natural-language statement about the usage terms pertaining to the content.

edNote.title: Editorial note
edNote.description: A note that is intended to be read by internal staff at the receiving organisation, but not intended to be published. Consider using this before using the descriptions array.

language.title: Language
language.description: The human language used by the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47.

descriptions.title: Descriptions
descriptions.description: An array of one or more descriptions of the ninjs object. See also edNote for information from provider to reciever. Descriptions are seen as metadata. For a simple description use an array with one object only containing the value property. Role and contentType are then undefined and their interpretation is up to the provider.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this description. Previously known as MIME Type.

value.title: Value
value.description: The descriptive text identified with the above role and/or contentType.

bodies.title: Bodies
bodies.description: An array of body objects with the content as text or with markup. For a simple body use an array with one object only containing the value property. If role and contentType are undefined, their interpretation is up to the provider.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this body. Previously known as MIME Type.

charCount.title: Character count
charCount.description: The total character count in this body excluding figure captions.

wordCount.title: Word count
wordCount.description: The total number of words in this body excluding figure captions.

value.title: Value
value.description: The body text identified with the above role and contentType.

headlines.title: Headlines
headlines.description: An array of objects containing various types of headlines. For a simple headline use an array with one object only containing the value property. Role and contentType are then undefined and it is up to the provider.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this headline. Previously known as MIME Type.

value.title: Value
value.description: The headline identified with the above role and/or contentType.

people.title: People
people.description: An array of objects describing individual human beings.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the person

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the person as a complete uri with the code.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the person as a free-text string.

organisations.title: Organisations
organisations.description: An array of objects describing administrative and functional structures which may, for example, act as a business, as a political party or not-for-profit entity.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the place

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the place as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the place as a free-text string.

subjects.title: Subjects
subjects.description: An array of objects holding concepts with a relationship to the content.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the subject

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the subject as a complete uri.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the subject as a free-text string.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: Specifies which entity (person, organisation or system) that created or last edited the property.

relevance.title: Relevance
relevance.description: The relevance of the metadata to the news item.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence with which the metadata has been assigned.

events.title: Events
events.description: An array of objects describing something which happens in a planned or unplanned manner.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the event.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the event as a complete uri.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the event as a free-text string.

eventDetails.title: Event Details
eventDetails.description: A container for properties related to a planned event.

eventStatus.description: Status of the event (as opposed to the status of coverage of the event). Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/eventstatus/

plannedCoverageStatus.description: Status of the coverage (as opposed to the status of the event itself). Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/newscoveragestatus/

dates.description: Dates and times for this event.

organiser.description: A person or organisation organising the event.

plannedCoverage.title: Planned Coverage
plannedCoverage.description: An array of objects specifying planned coverage which may or may not be related to an event.

uri.description: The local identifier of the element which MUST be persistent for all versions of the item, i.e. for its entire lifecycle.

title.description: A human-readable title for the planned content.

pubStatus.title: Publication status
pubStatus.description: The publishing status of the plannedCoverage object. Default value is 'usable'.

type.description: The generic news type of the planned content. Based on: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/ninature/ nar:itemClass

commissioned.description: Information about the commissioning of this content.

dates.description: Dates and times for this planned content.

audiences.description: Intended audiences for the planned content.

significance.description: A qualifier which indicates the expected significance of the content for this specific audience.

exclAudience.description: Excluded audience(s) for the planned content.

edNote.description: Additional natural language information about the planned content addressed to the editorial people receiving and processing the item.

urgency.description: The editorial urgency of the planned content, as scoped by the parent element.

language.description: The human language used by the planned content. The value should follow IETF BCP47.

itemCount.description: Number of planned items of this kind expressed by a range.

wordCount.description: The count of words of textual content.

renditions.title: Renditions
renditions.description: An array of objects showing the planned renditions of the news object.

objects.title: Objects
objects.description: An array of objects describing something material, excluding persons.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the object.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the object as a complete uri.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the object as a free-text string.

infoSources.title: Info sources
infoSources.description: An array of parties (person or organisation) which originated, modified, enhanced, distributed, aggregated or supplied the content or provided some information used to create or enhance the content.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role the infoSource in relationship to the content.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the infosource as a complete uri.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the infoSource as a free-text string.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short natural-language name for the item. Title is metadata, use headlines for publishable headlines.

by.title: By
by.description: A natural-language statement about the creator (author, photographer etc.) of the content.

slugline.title: Slugline
slugline.description: A human-readable identifier for the item.

located.title: Located
located.description: The name of the location from which the content originates.

renditions.title: Renditions
renditions.description: An array of objects with different renditions of the news object.

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: An array of objects with content of news objects which are associated with this news object.

items.description: Each associated object can use all properties in ninjs.

name.title: Name (of associated object)
name.description: Human-readable name of the associated object.

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship between this document and the associated document.

altIds.title: Alternative ids
altIds.description: Alternative identifiers assigned to the content. Each alternative id can have a role and a value.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the alternative id.

trustIndicators.title: Trust indicators
trustIndicators.description: An array of objects to allow links to documents about trust indicators.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the trust indicator as a complete URI. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/trustindicator

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the resource being referenced.

href.title: href
href.description: The URL for accessing the trust indicator resource.

standard.title: Standard
standard.description: An object with information about standard, version and schema this instance is valid against.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the standard to which this instance conforms, for example 'ninjs'.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the standard to which this instance conforms, for example '3.0'.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The URI of the JSON Schema to use for validating this instance, for example 'http://www.iptc.org/std/ninjs/ninjs-schema_3.0.json#'

genres.title: Genres
genres.description: Indicates a nature, journalistic or intellectual characteristic of the news item.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the genre as a complete URI. Suggested CV: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/genre

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the genre as a free-text string.

expires.title: Expires
expires.description: The date and time after which the Item is no longer considered editorially relevant by its provider.

rightsInfo.title: Rights information
rightsInfo.description: Expression of rights to be applied to content.

langId.title: Language id
langId.description: Identifier for the Rights Expression language used.

linkedRights.title: Linked rights
linkedRights.description: A link from the current Item to Web resource with rights related information.

encodedRights.title: Encoded Rights
encodedRights.description: Contains a rights expression as defined by a Rights Expression Language.
